snippet: To road test its new hybrid supercar, Porsche had its engineers drive two 918 Spyders from Denver to San Francisco, including a trip through the Nevada desert to see how the car reacted to the extreme heat.
abstract: Engineers converge in Nevada desert to test hot-weather performance of Porsche 918 Spyder, plug-in hybrid that combines electric drive and gasoline V-8 engine; car, scheduled to begin production in 2013, is capable of both efficient travel or heroic feats of sports car prowess.
lead_paragraph: To road test its new hybrid supercar, Porsche had its engineers drive two 918 Spyders from Denver to San Francisco, including a trip through the Nevada desert to see how the car reacted to the extreme heat.

headline.main: Between Auto Show and Showroom, a Supercar’s Mettle Is Tested
headline.print_headline: Between Auto Show and Showroom, a Supercar’s Mettle Is Tested
